conclusion: Person is at point O, height h1 = 15 m above water surface
Submarine is at depth h2 = 23 m below water surface
Angle of incidence is 53° (angle between line of sight and vertical)
Refractive index of water is n = 4/3
We need to find the horizontal distance between them
Apply Snell's Law: n1 sin(theta1) = n2 sin(theta2)
Calculate horizontal distance in air: x1 = 20 m
Calculate horizontal distance in water: x2 = 17.25 m
Total horizontal distance x = x1 + x2 = 37.25 m
The horizontal distance between the submarine and the person is 37.25 meters
